instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPRTC_G3H: What is PPRTC_G3H? This is a typo of PPVRTC_G3H When you see PPRTC_G3H, assume they meant to type PPVRTC_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
Got a macbook in today, its liquid damaged, the battery is swollen and doesn’t work.


The board has no corrosion whatsoever  and looks new, doesn’t look like its been cleaned. no burned components etc. 

put a new battery in and its charging fine. the mac just wouldn’t boot. fan spins, cpu cold to the touch,  tried smc. PRAM doesn’t work, no chime.

any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: CPU Vcore? Check corrosion in <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> area. Also check if USB mouse lights up, could be dead LCD too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
Been told it Has cpu Vcore , will confirm
no corrosion in the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> area
No light on usb mouse
Doesn’t seem like a dead lcd, as it has no chime


Update: Replaced <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and heated <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, no luck

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: And I still don't know if it has Vcore.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: Sorry forgot to update, no Vcore,  cpu does get a little warm after some time

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message:
new to this so ill try my best., Now theres no fan spin, just light on charger. don’t know what i did...

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V3</SIGNAL>  is 12.63v, shouldn’t it be 8.6v?, 

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> is 17.11v instead of 18.5v

These lines are present:

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>


Rest of the rails are 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: What happened? If you slipped with a probe or something I cannot diagnose that from here. Are you using a 60W charger? Is there corrosion under the SMC? Picture of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area? J6100 checked for corrosion?
